general_advisory: According to the extended range forecast, dry weather is expected over the districts of Odisha. Farmers are advised to provide irrigation, conduct spraying operations, keep fields weed-free, and monitor temperature conditions for crop and animal health.

advisory: Transplanting of 3-5 week old seedlings in well-puddled soil at appropriate spacing with proper fertilization.
Implement weed management strategies after transplanting to ensure crop health.
Monitor and control insect pests using pheromone traps and recommended insecticides.
Use yellow sticky traps per acre to control sucking insects.
Apply neem oil for insect control at the vegetative stage.
Avoid insecticide applications during the flowering stage.
Implement insect control measures similar to green gram at the appropriate stage of growth.
Protect mango trees from mealy bugs using polythene or alkathane sheet wrapping.
Prune diseased branches and leaves to manage fungal infections.
Use recommended insecticides to control leaf-eating caterpillars and fruit borers at different growth stages.
Regularly monitor and avoid chemical applications during flowering.
Feed animals a mixture of oil cakes and jaggery to maintain body temperature.
Provide additional feed to pregnant animals and ensure vaccination and deworming practices.
